alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 4:09PM EST until January 10 at 3:37PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Perkiomen Creek At Graterford affecting Montgomery County. For the Perkiomen Creek...including Graterford...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Perkiomen Creek at Graterford. * WHEN...From late tonight to tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Park Avenue in Schwenksville is flooded. The Perkiomen Trail is flooded in Perkiomen Township at Plank Road and Route 113. At 11.0 feet, Graterford Road and Penitentiary Bridge are closed due to flooding. At 12.0 feet, Portions of Central Perkiomen Park in Collegeville are flooded. Flood waters expand onto and to the west of First Avenue in Collegeville. At 13.0 feet, First Avenue in Collegeville becomes impassable. At 14.0 feet, Storm sewers back up in Collegeville and flood Route 29. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 2.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 13.0 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.9 feet on 12/25/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Stg Time Date Perkiomen Creek Graterford 11.0 2.4 Tue 3 pm 5.8 3.9 13.0 7am 1/10 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 415 AM EST.
